page.title: 17THE TOWN HALL
page.content: The Town Hall was built in 1200 by the freemen of Alnwick. In 1728 they decided to pull it down because it was old and falling down to start with. The freemen started building straight away and finished in 1736, 8 years later. The Town Hall cost Â£570 to build again. There are three rooms in the Town Hall: the Great Hall, the kitchen and the chamber. There used to be three names for the Town Hall, one the Weigh House because there was a big scale that used to weigh horses and carts. The others were the Toll House and the Counts. There is a cellar which used to be shops. Today coffee mornings and similar events are held there.
